page.title: 17ARBROATH LOCAL HISTORY.
page.content: Arbroath Football Club has been celebrating the hundredth anniversary of its record breaking 36-0 victory over Aberdeen Bon Accord and 1985 has seen the anniversary of another{event} which was to be important to the town. This was the opening of Kerr's Miniature Railway.The railway,which has delighted many{tourists}and locals over the years,is the oldest miniature railway in Scotland.A special open day is planned. Although Arbroath is a very old town,growing up around the Abbey,all the really old{housing}in our area has disappeared.People interested in{local {history}before the 19th. century would have to visit Kellie Castle,Arbirlot village,or Hospitalfield House which is now being modernised but was previously an art gallery.
